Grain.Do: Barley (1/2 cup cooked), Quinoa (1/2 cup cooked), Millet (1/2 cup cooked). These are lighter grains that pacify Kapha and are beneficial for diabetes.
Grain.Dont: Refined grains like white rice, white bread, pasta. These can increase Kapha and blood sugar.

Legume.Do: Mung beans (1/2 cup cooked), Lentils (red or yellow, 1/2 cup cooked). Easily digestible and good for managing blood sugar.
Legume.Dont: Heavy legumes like black beans, kidney beans. Can be harder to digest for Kapha types.

Veg.Do: Bitter gourd (1/2 cup cooked), Drumsticks (1/2 cup cooked), Radish (1/2 cup cooked), Asparagus (1 cup steamed), Okra (1/2 cup cooked). Bitter and astringent vegetables help manage diabetes and reduce Kapha.
Veg.Dont: Heavy, starchy vegetables like potatoes, sweet potatoes, yams. These can increase Kapha and blood sugar.

Spices.Do: Ginger (1/2 inch fresh or 1/4 tsp powder), Turmeric (1/4 tsp), Fenugreek (1/4 tsp seeds or powder), Cinnamon (1/4 tsp). These spices are excellent for digestion, blood sugar control, and reducing Kapha.
Spices.Dont: Excessive use of salt. Can lead to fluid retention and aggravate Kapha.

Leafy veg.Do: Spinach (1 cup cooked), Fenugreek leaves (1 cup cooked), Mustard greens (1 cup cooked). Light, bitter, and astringent greens are beneficial.
Leafy veg.Dont: Lettuce (iceberg). Lacks nutritional value and can be cooling.

Oil.Do: Mustard oil (1 tsp), Ghee (1 tsp, preferably clarified butter). Light and warming oils that aid digestion.
Oil.Dont: Excessive use of any oil, especially heavy oils like coconut oil or sesame oil in large quantities. Moderation is key for Kapha.

Fruits.Do: Apples (1 small, cooked or raw), Pears (1 small, cooked or raw), Berries (1/2 cup, e.g., blueberries, raspberries). Astringent and bitter fruits are preferred. Cooked fruits are easier to digest.
Fruits.Dont: Sweet and heavy fruits like bananas, mangoes, grapes, melons. Can increase Kapha and blood sugar.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Almonds (5-7 soaked, peeled), Walnuts (2-3 halves). Consume in moderation due to their grounding nature.
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Cashews, pistachios. These are heavier and can increase Kapha.

Milk product.Do: Low-fat buttermilk (1 cup). Fermented dairy is easier to digest and helps with Kapha.
Milk product.Dont: Full-fat milk, yogurt, cheese. These are heavy, cold, and increase Kapha.

Non-veg.Do: Lean chicken breast (2-3 oz, steamed or baked), Fish (2-3 oz, steamed or baked, e.g., mackerel, salmon). Lighter, easier-to-digest proteins.
Non-veg.Dont: Red meat, fried meats, heavy dairy-based meat dishes. These are too heavy and can increase Kapha.

Condiments.Do: Lemon juice (1 tsp), Black pepper (pinch). Stimulates digestion and reduces Kapha.
Condiments.Dont: Sweet pickles, heavy chutneys. Can increase Kapha and sugar.
